title: Task 1: Attribute the work to a specific artist
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions:
Response does not accurately attribute the work shown to the nineteenth-century artist who created it.

· Response does accurately attribute the work shown to Joseph Mallord William Turner (also acceptable: Turner)
· Response does accurately attribute the work shown to Joseph Mallord William Turner (also acceptable: Turner)

title: Task 2: Justify the attribution by explaining similarities with work by the artist
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not accurately use one example of specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work by the same artist.
Response accurately uses one example of specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work by the same artist.
Response accurately uses two examples of specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work by the same artist.

title: Task 3: Explain how context influences artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, and/or function in the creation or meaning of a work of art
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not accurately use an example of specific evidence to explain one way in which the work was influenced by Romanticism.
Response accurately uses specific evidence to explain one way in which the work was influenced by Romanticism.
Response accurately uses specific evidence to explain two ways in which the work was influenced by Romanticism.
